title: Pedestrian hit by car in Arlington dies of injuries
text:
A pedestrian hit by a car in Arlington last week has died, police said Wednesday.

The 55-year-old woman, whose family asked that her name be withheld, was crossing Little Falls Road near North Ohio Street with three dogs on Sept. 4 when she was hit by a car traveling westbound. She was hospitalized in critical condition and died Tuesday.

There is no traffic light at the intersection, although there is a sign telling drivers to stop for pedestrians. The driver remained on the scene and has not been charged with a crime. Police are still asking for witnesses.

The fatal crash occurred at the same intersection where a woman was hit and killed by a dump truck in 2014. The 55-year-old is the fourth killed by a driver in Arlington this year.

description: The woman was hit on Little Falls Road last week.
authors: Local Reporter Covering Federal Court In Alexandria
